description: Borrowed from Danish, Norwegian, and Swedish sk√•l.

verbs.description: skol (third-person singular simple present skols, present participle skolling, simple past and past participle skolled)

entries.meaning: (Australia, New Zealand, slang, transitive) To down (a drink).
examples: The Aussie skolled his beer, threw the Kiwi into the fireplace, and shot him.
